headline: Ultimate Frozen Strawberry Margarita
description: A strawberry margarita is a refreshing cocktail for a hot summer day. Ready in minutes, this one's made with frozen berries and limeade concentrate.

video.description: Nothing quite like strawberries and limeade to get you feeling refreshed! a
video.name: Ultimate Frozen Strawberry Margarita

name: Ultimate Frozen Strawberry Margarita
recipeIngredient: 2 cups ice cubes, or as needed
8 ounces frozen sliced strawberries in syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Gather ingredients and fill a blender with ice cubes. Pulse until ice is crushed.
Pour in tequila and triple sec, then add strawberries and limeade concentrate.
Blend until smooth, about 30 seconds. Pour into four margarita glasses and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! The day after the Super Bowl the syruped strawberries were sold out. I added 1/8 C. of sugar to unsweetened frozen strawberries. The ideal blend of sweet and tart! Super easy for a usual wine drinker.

OMG My first time making a Strawberry Margarita and this recipe was the very best! I did as one person said and doubled the amount of strawberries and it was the best margarita I've had in years! it was so easy too! I love it!

This is the BEST frozen strawberry margarita recipe! E V E R!! The only thing that we changed was the triple sec, we added margarita mix. We have used Jose Quervo gold and 818 tequila. It is definitely a must to try!
came out perfect, recipe very simple
Perfect amount for 4 margarita glasses. Not too strong, not too sweet! Everyone loved them.
Used fresh strawberries and it was great! Better than going out for sure!

This margarita is awesome. I did some modifications based on comments from other reviewers. I used 4 oz tequila instead of 6, I used 8oz frozen strawberries with no syrup and I added 1/4 cup of sugar. It was perfect. Strong but not overwhelming. I also added a few pieces of ice to make it more slushy. Everyone enjoyed. The recipe makes 2 margaritas. If you need more than 2, double or triple the recipe.
This margarita taste great!

I made this using whole frozen strawberries, agave syrup, and fresh lime juice to reduce the calories and it was delicious. I basically just looked up the recipe to have a guide as to how much alcohol to add.
Loved it!
Excellent. Will be using this moving forward! We sometimes throw half a large jalapeno in for a sweet and spicy version.
I thought this recipe was super easy and good. I used fresh limes and squeezed a little agave in.
These are the BEST margaritas I have ever had! I wouldn’t change a thing!!
These are the BEST margaritas I have ever had! I wouldn’t change a thing!!
fantastic and a huge hit!!!
This margarita was delicious, and a big hit with everyone! I don’t have any complaints. Didn’t take too much time to prepare either.

Super yum. I tweaked it to accommodate 2 people. Added a little fresh lime juice and used frozen strawberries sans syrup. I added a touch of light agave instead. Swapped out frozen Limeade with lemonade, and used Cointreau instead of triple sec . Great simple recipe !
Yummy!

The best ever! I just used this recipe and just enjoyed the best strawberry margarita ever! I'm giving this 5 stars and would give it more if I could. I'm not one to believe that you should rate a recipe 5 stars, if not followed exactly, HOWEVER, I used organic frozen strawberries and added 2 ounces of strawberry syrup, since my frozen strawberries had no syrup and I still think it deserves 5 stars!!!
Delicious! My guests enjoyed them!!!

Perfect Margarita!!!!
No changes were needed...
It was loved by one and all. THe limeade really makes the recipe. When we ran out of strawberries we blended watermelon and that was also delicious.
so good!
so good!
Didn't have the strawberries in syrup just no sugar added and they where still perfect. Put extra in the freezer and had great frozen margarita ices!!!
Finally, a cocktail recipe that turned out exactly like it was supposed to! So. Good.
We added frozen strawberries and strawberry concentrate. Amazing!!!
As awesome as it was 10yrs ago. I don’t drink hard liquor often, but when I do, I go with the best recipe.

I added 4 oz of tequila instead of 6 and just added sugar to the frozen strawberries to make it syrupy. I got large daiquiri glasses and we ended up with two full glasses. Absolutely delicious. Only problem is that... it doesn’t last long ;-)
This is fantastic! I varied the recipe and used fresh strawberry, blueberry, and raspberry. It was great with and without sugar. Thank you for posting it!
I added 15ml agave nectar. Really good on a hot day.
Omg simply delicious!!!!
Very good. A little tart but still good.
Perfect combination of tequila and triple sec. I have a Margaritalville blender and this recipe made the perfect Margarita! I used Pomagranite juice instead of strawberries. YUMMY!
Delicious ! No changes, we loved it
I love this margarita. Will definitely be making again.

Delicious. Used a Ninja drink blender and it came out a perfect, smooth slush. Cointreau and Cazadores tequila were my choices along with generic limeade concentrate and a cup filled with frozen strawberries then poured over Daily's strawberry mix to the cup mark. It turned out strong but balanced and very drinkable.
This is one of my favorite drinks. It’s very easy to make and has become a staple at dinner parties in summer.
This is a foolproof recipe. Always tastes great and simple to make.

This was great! My best friend always talks about how great the margaritas at the Mexican restaurant near our house are and how she wishes she could get the recipe. She said this recipe was better! I did add 1/2 cup of sugar to make it extra sweet
This is soooo good! And so easy! We keep making this, love it!
Awesome! Made it with fresh cut strawberries cut up in sugar and used the syrup as well - - used a bit more strawberries than called for. Will make this all summer!
Definitely will make it again, it's so much better than pre made mixes.
So good! I cut back the tequila to 4 oz and bumped the triple sec up to 3 because I didn't want the drinks very strong. Easy & delicious!
Loved it!!!

This was a huge hit with my strawberry margarita loving friends. It even converted me, who prefers lime margaritas over fruity ones. I did add a little extra strawberries per other reviews. It's my new go to strawberry margarita recipe!

A friend dropped by and asked me to make her a frozen strawberry margarita like the one she had on her recent Florida vacation. A Google search found me this recipe. I did modify it slightly by using 4 oz of fresh lime juice and added 2 oz of cane sugar syrup for sweetness (instead of limeade). It went over well with my guests. Two pitchers full well received. Would have made more but ran out of limes, strawberries and Tequila. Refreshed my stock today!!!!

After working all day on home improvements, my family and I were thirsty. Looked up some recipes, and this came up. It did its job well. I am buzzed and it tasted great. Alcohol was at a reasonable level for one that drinks. Great Job!!
I loved this margarita! I actually used a very cheap tequila too so I can't imagine how a nicer brand would taste! I also used lime juice to make the sugar rim and it worked perfectly.
Super easy to make and great margaritas. Not over-powering, even for my alcohol sensitive wife. Using a good tequila helps a bunch. I will make exactly as written again.
Tasted like a restaurant margarita - I don't have a large blender so I cut the recipe in half and made it in my Nutribullet. So easy, fast and delicious!
absolutely a delicious drink
Was delicious but the alcohol was very dominate in this drink. Will definitely use maybe half the amount suggested. Was way too strong but still the flavor was great
I love a good strawberry margarita and this is delicious
Quick easy and delicious!!!!
This was sooo good! Will be making again and again...lol
It was a hit! Perfect flavor!
I made no changes and it was a hit. So good perfect for a hot summer barbecue.
Very good strawberry margarita! I used strawberry's from Food Lion that had splenda in them. Changed the flavor a little bit but cut back on the sugar and calories.

These were amazing!! I had four of them down before I even realized it!! I made them for a Mexican dinner I made for some family and they were a huge hit!! We had two pitchers gone between four of us in no time!! I used fresh strawberries that I added sugar to the night before and it turned out great!!!
This was fantastic! Used just a bit less tequila and triple sec and it was perfect!
No changes made. This was delicious. Made it for me and my boyfriend and he loved it too. I just sat the blender on the table instead of the refridgerator

My go to and I woudln't change a thing. I keep all the ingredients on hand so to make at any time. I will sometimes make without adding the strawberries in syrup for a lime version, still just as good.

It was ok I have definitely had better margaritas. I will stick to fresh strawberries in the future, I felt like using frozen just did not have the same strawberry flavor as using fresh does leaving the drink tasting a little watery.
Delish! I did add some extra strawberries, but oh so good! Will definitely make them again.
Also worked with whole frozen strawberries. added a little extra sugar since I didn't have the strawberry syrup.
Tastes like it came from a Mexican restaurant! I was pleased with the turnout. I wish it was a little thicker though. I put 4 ounces of tequila instead of 6 and it was plenty!
Mighty Fine !!
This is the Ultimate Strawberry Margarita! The only change I made was to add a little Stevia and use Lime Juice instead of Limeade, to cut down on the sugar.
Fantastic.. I did the strawberries without the syrup. Still tastes perfect!

This was the best-tasting strawberry margarita I ever had!!! Varied the recipe for 4 servings as follows: 4 oz of fresh squeezed lime juice with pulp instead of the lime concentrate; 4 oz of tequila (used Alacran tequila - tequila blanco, 100% agave and 40% alcohol; any tequila blanco or white tequila will work) instead of 6 oz; increased triple sec Cointreanu from 2 oz to 4 oz; increased unsweetened frozen strawberries from 8 oz to 10 oz; added about 2-3 tablespoons of azucar morena to taste; placed all ingredients in the blender and added crushed ice until it was filled. Thanks for sharing the recipe and reviews!
vgomezquita
Had to triple the strawberries and it still wwasn't enough strawberry flavor. Barely taste the tequila,too.

this was by far the best ever...my husband absolutely loved it and my daughters said it was the best they have ever tasted...I don't drink, so I went on their recommendations...they are a very critical crew so I always defer to their tastes! LOVED IT
Definitely an ultimate margarita! A big hit at get togethers.

Good but use frozen or fresh strawberries without sugar! You could use simple syrup for more sweetness BUT I found the sugar in the lime concentrate to be sweet enough for me! Rub rim of glass with a slice of lime before adding sugar!

Never made these before. Was in the mood and found this recipe. Due to the reviews, I followed the recipe with the sweetened strawberries, and added frozen strawberries and less ice. Awesome! We are on the fourth pitcher!
Best strawberry margarita ever!!
Perfection!
Everyone loved it, including the kids (virgin).

First time making a Margarita - it will not be my last!! The only thing I changed was to use fresh strawberries - 3 cups to 1/4 cup sugar - semi froze them and added ALL of them into the blender - which did cut down a bit on the ice...maybe 4+ cups of ice. My Favorite Five (the girls I work with) LOVED them!!! They were so impressed - especially since they know that I have never mixed a drink before in my life....and that has been a long time ;) I mix everything together (except Ice) and freeze. When ready to use I thaw and blend with ice.
Even the guys skipped their beers and drank these. Soooo yummy.

This makes for a great Margarita! Sugar or salt on the glass works. I used Orange flavored Triple Sec, and added whipped cream to the top of the finished product. Rave reviews. Infinitely cheaper than what you'd pay at a restaurant, yet every bit as good

Delicious! I used the whole can of limeade and adjusted the other ingredients accordingly. I blended everything up (minus the ice), and froze it in a container in the freezer. When I needed it, it was perfectly slushy and delicious. A definite keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
I made these for our Fantasy Football draft. Being the only girl in the league, I thought I'd get the whole pitcher. The beer drinking guys loved them! Buy more supplies than you think you'll need.
I did a virgin strawberry margarita and it turned out great. Had to add some water to make up for the lack of liquid but still turned out great!
Great! Will make again and again! I add extra lime just because I like the citrus taste but this recipe rocks!
It was ok... not great.
This is the very best formula. Also I sub rum for tequila for a Dacquiri. I have used one pound of frozen ,no sugar berries. If you like less sugar .bill mandell

These are delicious! I put it all in the blender at once and it was so easy. The people who did not rate them well need to learn that this is the kind of recipe you tweek to your liking. If you think it has too much alcohol or not enough, change the amount! For my preferences, this margharita was perfect. Also, none of us thought it was too sweet. There's enough techila to tone down the sweetness in the other ingredients. Just play with it. If you are worried about the frozen strawberries with syrup being too sweet, use only 4 oz of them and add either plain frozen or fresh berries. It's not hard people. Don't lower the rating of the recipe by several stars just because all of us have different taste buds.

Very good drink; we use 2 oz of frozen strawberry punch concentrate and 2 oz of limeade, to bring out the strawberry flavor. We also coat the glasses with sugar instead of salt. Because the drink is so fruity, we make a batch w/o tequila for the kids, or pour them some before adding a little less tequila for our drinks. Also, a good orange liqueur will work as a substitute for triple sec.
Tweaked this recipe a bit after reading others on the Internet. Why aren't the ingredients measured in ounces, like every other drink recipe??????????

Fantastic! We made a triple batch for our Cinco de Mayo fiesta! I mixed up all the ingredients (except the ice) the night before, put it in a Ziploc and put it in the freezer. We crushed up a blender full of ice, poured 1/3 of the mixture in, stirred it and then spooned it into our glasses. Repeated twice throughout the night! HUGE hit! Can't wait to experiment with other flavor combos all summer long!
I usually don't rate recipes but this is really good. Highly recommend it. I added a few fresh strawberries to the recipe. You will love it.

Made with fresh strawberries, just slice them put them in a ziplock bag with just enough sugar to coat and freeze them. I can't tell you how many times I heard our guest say, "Dang these are good margaritas".

Excellent margarita recipe! At last, I have found "my" drink. Strong enough to kick my butt, but delicious enough to enjoy getting there. I just cannot rave about this drink enough. And it was so easy! I never try mixing drinks, but this one turned out delicious on the first attempt just by following the easy directions. So great!

This is a great frozen margarita recipe. It was ridiculously easy to make and tasted so good! My sister-in-law noted that many times strawberry margaritas can be too sweet. However, the lime in this margarita recipe provides some tartness that balances it out. I will definitely use this recipe again.

I love the recipe, but I used the frozen the first time, and I had to double it to get strawberry flavor. The next time I used about 10 fresh strawberries and some juice from the frozen, and that helped. I like the recipe, but you need to decide where your flavor is with the strawberry. Good luck.
Love this recipe! Just perfect! I get compliments on it all the time!
Excellent. Thanks for sharing.
